radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the brain without contrast
radiographic_examinations.findings: Scattered T2-weighted hyperintense foci in the deep and subcortical cerebral white matter bilaterally, suggestive of mild microangiopathic changes, with no associated restricted diffusion.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: MRI after administration of contrast material revealed features the same as previous study, including increased T2-weighted signal intensity and mild expansion of the left amygdala and hippocampus without enhancement; persistent mild nonspecific white matter change.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Magnetic resonance angiography of the head
radiographic_examinations.findings: No hemodynamically significant intracranial arterial stenosis.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Computed tomography (CT) of the chest and abdomen
radiographic_examinations.findings: Multiple renal cysts, a small infrarenal abdominal aortic aneurysm measuring 3.3 cm, and no evidence of cancer in the chest, abdomen, or pelvis.
Initial focus of abnormal hypermetabolism in the left medial temporal lobe; follow-up showed increased hypermetabolism most pronounced in the amygdaloid nucleus.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Reduction in hypermetabolism noted as the patient's symptoms improved over time.
